title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: ervissexplore package makes easy retrieve ERVISS (European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary) data EU-ECDC. provides functions fetch filter data, plus optional visualization tools. package works two data sources EU-ECDC Respiratory Viruses Weekly Data repository: Positivity data (sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv): Test positivity rates pathogen country Variants data (variants.csv): SARS-CoV-2 variant proportions country
code: library(ervissexplore)

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: Positivity data comes sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv file.

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: Use get_sentineltests_positivity() fetch positivity data:
code: # Get SARS-CoV-2 positivity data for specific countries data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany", "Italy", "Spain") )  # Explore the data head(data) str(data)

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: reproducible analyses, can fetch data specific snapshot:
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2023-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2023-12-31"),   pathogen = "Influenza",   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2024-02-23") )

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: Variant data comes variants.csv file.

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: Use get_erviss_variants() fetch SARS-CoV-2 variant data:
code: # Get specific variants data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG", "LP.8.1", "BA.2.86"),   countries = c("Belgium", "Denmark", "France") )  # Get all variants with minimum proportion threshold data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   min_value = 5 # Only variants with >= 5% proportion )

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: data returned data.table, can analyze data.table syntax:
code: # Get positivity data (returns a data.table) data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2" )  # Calculate summary statistics by country data[,   .(     mean_positivity = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE),     max_positivity = max(value, na.rm = TRUE),     n_weeks = .N   ),   by = countryname ]

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: package provides optional visualization functions quick exploration.

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
code: # Get data first data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany") )  # Then plot plot_erviss_positivity(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: quick visualization without saving data:
code: quick_plot_erviss_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany", "Italy"),   date_breaks = "1 month",   date_format = "%b %Y" )  quick_plot_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2025-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2025-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG", "LP.8.1"),   date_breaks = "1 month",   countries = c("Belgium", "Denmark", "France") )

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: can also create visualizations:
code: library(ggplot2)  data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2" )  ggplot(data, aes(x = date, y = value, color = countryname)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1) +   labs(     title = "SARS-CoV-2 Positivity Rates",     x = "Date",     y = "Positivity (%)",     color = "Country"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: can retrieve data URLs directly prefer download files manually:
code: # Latest data URLs get_sentineltests_positivity_url() #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv" get_erviss_variants_url() #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/variants.csv"  # Snapshot URLs get_sentineltests_positivity_url(   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2023-11-24") ) #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/snapshots/2023-11-24_sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv" get_erviss_variants_url(   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2023-11-24") ) #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/snapshots/2023-11-24_variants.csv"

title: Getting Started with ervissexplore
text: ’s complete workflow analyzing variant data:
code:
library(ervissexplore)  # 1. Define parameters countries <- c("France", "Germany", "Italy", "Spain", "Belgium") start_date <- as.Date("2024-06-01") end_date <- as.Date("2024-12-31")  # 2. Retrieve data variant_data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = start_date,   date_max = end_date,   countries = countries,   min_value = 1 )  # 3. Explore the data cat("Number of observations:", nrow(variant_data), "
") cat("Countries:", unique(variant_data$countryname), "
") cat("Variants:", unique(variant_data$variant), "
")  # 4. Find the dominant variants (data.table syntax) dominant <- variant_data[, .(mean_proportion = mean(value)), by = variant][   order(-mean_proportion) ][1:5]  print(dominant)  # 5. Visualize top variants top_variants <- dominant$variant  quick_plot_erviss_variants(   date_min = start_date,   date_max = end_date,   variant = top_variants,   countries = countries,   date_breaks = "1 month",   min_value = 1 )

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {ervissexplore: Analyse of the erviss data},   author = {Yohann Mansiaux},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Analyse of the erviss data
text: R package easily retrieve ERVISS (European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary) data EU-ECDC. Provides functions fetch, filter, optionally visualize respiratory virus positivity rates SARS-CoV-2 variant proportions across European countries.

title: Analyse of the erviss data
code: install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Epiconcept-Paris/ervissexplore")

title: Analyse of the erviss data
code: library(ervissexplore)  # Retrieve SARS-CoV-2 positivity data positivity_data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany", "Italy") )  # Retrieve variant data variant_data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG", "LP.8.1") )  # The data is ready for your own analysis head(positivity_data) #>                 survtype countryname yearweek   pathogen pathogentype #>                   <char>      <char>   <char>     <char>       <char> #> 1: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W52 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 2: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W51 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 3: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W50 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 4: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W49 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 5: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W48 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 6: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W47 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #>    pathogensubtype  indicator    age value       date #>             <char>     <char> <char> <num>     <Date> #> 1:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   2.1 2024-12-23 #> 2:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   4.1 2024-12-16 #> 3:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   4.1 2024-12-09 #> 4:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   3.8 2024-12-02 #> 5:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   6.2 2024-11-25 #> 6:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   6.4 2024-11-18 summary(variant_data) #>    survtype          datasource        countryname          yearweek         #>  Length:4           Length:4           Length:4           Length:4           #>  Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   #>  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   #>                                                                              #>                                                                              #>                                                                              #>    pathogen           variant           indicator             age            #>  Length:4           Length:4           Length:4           Length:4           #>  Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   #>  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   #>                                                                              #>                                                                              #>                                                                              #>      value           date            #>  Min.   :0.10   Min.   :2024-10-28   #>  1st Qu.:0.10   1st Qu.:2024-10-28   #>  Median :0.55   Median :2024-10-31   #>  Mean   :0.60   Mean   :2024-10-31   #>  3rd Qu.:1.05   3rd Qu.:2024-11-04   #>  Max.   :1.20   Max.   :2024-11-04

title: Analyse of the erviss data
text: package fetches data directly EU-ECDC Respiratory Viruses Weekly Data repository. Two data types available: Positivity: Test positivity rates pathogen country (sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv) Variants: SARS-CoV-2 variant proportions country (variants.csv)

title: Analyse of the erviss data
text: default, functions fetch latest available data: reproducibility, can use historical snapshots: get list available snapshots, visit EU-ECDC Respiratory Viruses Weekly Data repository.
code: # Latest data (default) data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31") ) # Use a specific snapshot for reproducible analyses data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2023-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2023-12-31"),   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2024-02-23") )

title: Analyse of the erviss data
code: # Get positivity data (returns a data.table) data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = c("SARS-CoV-2", "Influenza"),   countries = c("France", "Spain", "Italy") )  # Your own analysis with data.table syntax data[,   .(     mean_positivity = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE),     max_positivity = max(value, na.rm = TRUE)   ),   by = .(countryname, pathogen) ] #>    countryname   pathogen mean_positivity max_positivity #>         <char>     <char>           <num>          <num> #> 1:      France  Influenza       19.223077           58.7 #> 2:      France SARS-CoV-2        8.942308           66.7 #> 3:       Italy  Influenza       12.670588           40.5 #> 4:       Italy SARS-CoV-2        2.247059           10.4 #> 5:       Spain  Influenza        7.361538           43.7 #> 6:       Spain SARS-CoV-2       10.626923           45.6

title: Analyse of the erviss data
code: # Option 1: Separate steps (more control) data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Spain") ) plot_erviss_positivity(data, date_breaks = "1 month") # Option 2: Quick one-liner quick_plot_erviss_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   date_breaks = "1 month",   countries = c("France", "Spain") )

title: Analyse of the erviss data
code: # If you have downloaded the data locally data <- get_erviss_variants(   csv_file = "path/to/local/variants.csv",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31") )

title: Analyse of the erviss data
text: New contributors welcome ! can contribute package many ways: reporting bugs, issues feature requests: please open issue GitHub repository. fixing bugs improving package: please clone fork repository, work dedicated branch create pull request.

title: Get ERVISS variants data — get_erviss_variants
text: Retrieves filters SARS-CoV-2 variant data ERVISS (European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary) specified date range, variant(s), country(ies).

title: Get ERVISS variants data — get_erviss_variants
code: get_erviss_variants(   csv_file = NULL,   date_min,   date_max,   variant = "",   countries = "",   min_value = 0,   indicator = "proportion",   use_snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_date = NULL )

title: Get ERVISS variants data — get_erviss_variants
text: csv_file Path local CSV file URL containing ERVISS data. NULL (default), data fetched official ERVISS repository. date_min Start date period (Date object) date_max End date period (Date object) variant Character vector variant names filter. Use "" (default) include variants. countries Character vector country names filter. Use "" (default) include countries. min_value Minimum value threshold include results (default: 0) indicator Type indicator: "proportion" (default) "detections" use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, fetches historical snapshot; FALSE (default), fetches latest data. Ignored csv_file provided. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve. Required use_snapshot = TRUE csv_file NULL.

title: Get ERVISS variants data — get_erviss_variants
text: data.table containing filtered variant data columns: date, value, variant, countryname, indicator, ERVISS fields.

title: Get ERVISS variants data — get_erviss_variants
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get latest variant data for France data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   countries = "France" )  # Get specific variants with minimum proportion threshold data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG", "LP.8.1"),   min_value = 5 ) } # }

what: Get ERVISS variants data URL — get_erviss_variants_url
title: Get ERVISS variants data URL — get_erviss_variants_url
text: Builds URL download ERVISS variants data, either latest batch specific snapshot.

title: Get ERVISS variants data URL — get_erviss_variants_url
code: get_erviss_variants_url(use_snapshot = FALSE, snapshot_date = NULL)

title: Get ERVISS variants data URL — get_erviss_variants_url
text: use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, returns snapshot URL; FALSE (default), returns URL latest data. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve (required use_snapshot = TRUE). Must Date object.

title: Get ERVISS variants data URL — get_erviss_variants_url
text: character string containing URL

title: Get ERVISS variants data URL — get_erviss_variants_url
code: # Get latest data URL get_erviss_variants_url() #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/variants.csv"  # Get snapshot URL get_erviss_variants_url(use_snapshot = TRUE, snapshot_date = as.Date("2023-11-24")) #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/snapshots/2023-11-24_variants.csv"

title: Get ERVISS positivity data — get_sentineltests_positivity
text: Retrieves filters positivity data ERVISS (European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary) specified date range, pathogen(s), country(ies).

title: Get ERVISS positivity data — get_sentineltests_positivity
code: get_sentineltests_positivity(   csv_file = NULL,   date_min,   date_max,   pathogen = "",   countries = "",   use_snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_date = NULL )

title: Get ERVISS positivity data — get_sentineltests_positivity
text: csv_file Path local CSV file URL containing ERVISS data. NULL (default), data fetched official ERVISS repository. date_min Start date period (Date object) date_max End date period (Date object) pathogen Character vector pathogen names filter. Use "" (default) include pathogens. countries Character vector country names filter. Use "" (default) include countries. use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, fetches historical snapshot; FALSE (default), fetches latest data. Ignored csv_file provided. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve. Required use_snapshot = TRUE csv_file NULL.

title: Get ERVISS positivity data — get_sentineltests_positivity
text: data.table containing filtered positivity data columns: date, value, pathogen, countryname, ERVISS fields.

title: Get ERVISS positivity data — get_sentineltests_positivity
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get latest SARS-CoV-2 positivity data for France data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = "France" )  # Get historical data from a specific snapshot data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2023-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2023-12-31"),   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2024-02-23") ) } # }

code: get_sentineltests_positivity_url(use_snapshot = FALSE, snapshot_date = NULL)

text: use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, returns snapshot URL; FALSE (default), returns URL latest data. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve (required use_snapshot = TRUE). Must Date object.

title: Get ERVISS positivity data URL — get_sentineltests_positivity_url
code: # Get latest data URL get_sentineltests_positivity_url() #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv"  # Get snapshot URL get_sentineltests_positivity_url(use_snapshot = TRUE, snapshot_date = as.Date("2023-11-24")) #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/snapshots/2023-11-24_sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv"

title: Plot ERVISS positivity data — plot_erviss_positivity
text: Creates ggplot2 visualization positivity data, facets country colored pathogen. plot title displays mean, min max positivity values.

title: Plot ERVISS positivity data — plot_erviss_positivity
code: plot_erviss_positivity(data, date_breaks = "2 weeks", date_format = "%b %Y")

title: Plot ERVISS positivity data — plot_erviss_positivity
text: data data.table data.frame containing positivity data, typically output get_sentineltests_positivity. Must contain columns: date, value, pathogen, countryname. date_breaks string specifying date breaks x-axis (e.g., "1 month", "2 weeks") date_format string specifying date format x-axis labels (e.g., "%b %Y" "Jan 2024")

title: Plot ERVISS positivity data — plot_erviss_positivity
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot ERVISS positivity data — plot_erviss_positivity
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2" ) plot_erviss_positivity(data, date_breaks = "1 month") } # }

title: Plot ERVISS variants data — plot_erviss_variants

text: data data.table data.frame containing variant data, typically output get_erviss_variants. Must contain columns: date, value, variant, countryname. date_breaks string specifying date breaks x-axis (e.g., "1 month", "2 weeks") date_format string specifying date format x-axis labels (e.g., "%b %Y" "Jan 2024")

what: Quick plot of ERVISS positivity data — quick_plot_erviss_positivity
title: Quick plot of ERVISS positivity data — quick_plot_erviss_positivity
text: Convenience function fetches plots ERVISS positivity data one step. control, use get_sentineltests_positivity followed plot_erviss_positivity.

title: Quick plot of ERVISS positivity data — quick_plot_erviss_positivity
code: quick_plot_erviss_positivity(   csv_file = NULL,   date_min,   date_max,   pathogen = "",   countries = "",   date_breaks = "2 weeks",   date_format = "%b %Y",   use_snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_date = NULL )

title: Quick plot of ERVISS positivity data — quick_plot_erviss_positivity
text: csv_file Path local CSV file URL containing ERVISS data. NULL (default), data fetched official ERVISS repository. date_min Start date period (Date object) date_max End date period (Date object) pathogen Character vector pathogen names filter. Use "" (default) include pathogens. countries Character vector country names filter. Use "" (default) include countries. date_breaks string specifying date breaks x-axis (e.g., "1 month", "2 weeks") date_format string specifying date format x-axis labels (e.g., "%b %Y" "Jan 2024") use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, fetches historical snapshot; FALSE (default), fetches latest data. Ignored csv_file provided. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve. Required use_snapshot = TRUE csv_file NULL.

title: Quick plot of ERVISS positivity data — quick_plot_erviss_positivity
text: ggplot2 object showing positivity time country pathogen

title: Quick plot of ERVISS positivity data — quick_plot_erviss_positivity
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Quick visualization of latest data quick_plot_erviss_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   date_breaks = "1 month" ) } # }

what: Quick plot of ERVISS variants data — quick_plot_erviss_variants
title: Quick plot of ERVISS variants data — quick_plot_erviss_variants
text: Convenience function fetches plots ERVISS variant data one step. control, use get_erviss_variants followed plot_erviss_variants.

title: Quick plot of ERVISS variants data — quick_plot_erviss_variants
code: quick_plot_erviss_variants(   csv_file = NULL,   date_min,   date_max,   variant = "",   countries = "",   min_value = 0,   indicator = "proportion",   date_breaks = "1 month",   date_format = "%b %Y",   use_snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_date = NULL )

title: Quick plot of ERVISS variants data — quick_plot_erviss_variants
text: csv_file Path local CSV file URL containing ERVISS data. NULL (default), data fetched official ERVISS repository. date_min Start date period (Date object) date_max End date period (Date object) variant Character vector variant names filter. Use "" (default) include variants. countries Character vector country names filter. Use "" (default) include countries. min_value Minimum value threshold include results (default: 0) indicator Type indicator: "proportion" (default) "detections" date_breaks string specifying date breaks x-axis (e.g., "1 month", "2 weeks") date_format string specifying date format x-axis labels (e.g., "%b %Y" "Jan 2024") use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, fetches historical snapshot; FALSE (default), fetches latest data. Ignored csv_file provided. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve. Required use_snapshot = TRUE csv_file NULL.

title: Quick plot of ERVISS variants data — quick_plot_erviss_variants
text: ggplot2 object showing variant proportions time country

title: Quick plot of ERVISS variants data — quick_plot_erviss_variants
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Quick visualization of latest variant data quick_plot_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG", "LP.8.1"),   date_breaks = "1 month" ) } # }
